summary:
The Security Council,
Reaffirming previous resolutions on the International Tribunal for Rwanda, 
Having considered letters from the Secretary-General and the President of the International Tribunal for Rwanda,
Convinced of the need to enhance the powers of ad litem judges and increase their number,
 
1. Decides to amend articles 11 and 12 quater of the Statute of the International Tribunal for Rwanda, 
replacing them with the provisions in the annex;
2. Decides to remain seized of the matter.

Annex 
 Article 11 - Composition of the Chambers 
- The Chambers shall have 16 permanent and a maximum of 9 ad litem judges.
- Each Trial Chamber shall have 3 permanent and a maximum of 6 ad litem judges.

 Article 12 quater - Status of ad litem judges 
- Ad litem judges shall have the same terms and conditions of service, powers, privileges and immunities as permanent judges.
- Ad litem judges can adjudicate in pre-trial proceedings in cases other than those they were appointed to try.
- Ad litem judges are not eligible for election as President or Presiding Judge.
The Appeals Chamber shall have power: 
(i) To adopt rules of procedure and evidence pursuant to article 14 of the present Statute, but shall be consulted before their adoption; 
(ii) To review an indictment pursuant to article 18; 
(iii) To consult with the President of the International Tribunal for Rwanda on judge assignment pursuant to article 13 or on pardon/commutation of sentence pursuant to article 27.
